remarks: An infinite sum of nonnegative terms is equal to the supremum of the partial sums.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jun-2014.)
statement:
isumsup.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
isumsup.2 $e |- G = seq M ( + , F ) $.
isumsup.3 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ZZ ) $.
isumsup.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
isumsup.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. RR ) $.
isumsup.6 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> 0 <_ A ) $.
isumsup.7 $e |- ( ph -> E. x e. RR A. j e. Z ( G ` j ) <_ x ) $.
isumsup $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. Z A = sup ( ran G , RR , < ) ) $.
$d A j x $.
$d F j k x $.
$d G j x $.
$d M j k x $.
$d Z j k x $.
$d j k ph $.
